snippet: The merger ends more than a year of ruthless battles for market share in the mainland and values the new company at $35 billion....
abstract: Uber will sell Chinese operation to rival Didi Chuxing, ending its fierce two-year battle for market dominance in mainland China and joining ranks of other American companies unable to gain foothold there; deal will give Uber $7 billion share in new $35 billion company.

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and MIKE ISAAC
byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong, and Mike Isaac from San Francisco. Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting from New York. Cao Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The merger ends more than a year of ruthless battles for market share in the mainland and values the new company at $35 billion.

headline.main: Uber to Sell to Rival Didi Chuxing and Create New Business in China
headline.print_headline: Uber Cedes Ride-Hailing in China to a Rival
